tasks.title: üöÄ Onboarding Guide ‚Äî Set Up Mission Control
tasks.description: Welcome to Mission Control! Follow these steps to complete your setup. Work through each subtask in order.\n\n**Tip:** Click on a subtask to see detailed instructions. Check it off when done.

subtasks.title: 1. Enable GitHub Pages: Settings ‚Üí Pages ‚Üí Branch: main ‚Üí Save
2. Create GitHub Token: github.com/settings/tokens ‚Üí Generate (classic) ‚Üí Scope: repo
3. Connect Dashboard: Open your GitHub Pages URL ‚Üí Click 'Connect GitHub' ‚Üí Paste token
4. Install Tailscale: brew install tailscale && tailscale up
5. Enable Funnel: tailscale funnel 18789 ‚Üí Copy your URL
6. Generate Webhook Token: openssl rand -hex 32 ‚Üí Save it
7. Add GitHub Webhook: Settings ‚Üí Webhooks ‚Üí Add ‚Üí URL: https://YOUR-TAILSCALE-URL/hooks/github?token=YOUR-TOKEN
8. Test: Create a task, move to In Progress, verify MoltBot receives notification

comments.author: Mission Control
comments.text: Once all steps are complete, you can archive this guide or keep it as reference. Your setup is done when MoltBot responds to task changes!

tasks.title: üìñ User Guide ‚Äî How to Use Mission Control
tasks.description:
Learn how to use Mission Control effectively. Both you AND MoltBot can manage tasks!

**Two ways to manage tasks:**
‚Ä¢ üë§ **You** ‚Äî Use the Dashboard UI (drag & drop, buttons, forms)
‚Ä¢ ü§ñ **MoltBot** ‚Äî Uses CLI scripts or edits tasks.json directly

subtasks.title: Columns: Permanent (recurring) ‚Üí Backlog ‚Üí In Progress ‚Üí Review ‚Üí Done
Drag & Drop: Move tasks between columns to change status
Click task card to open details and edit

comments.author: Mission Control
comments.text: This guide stays in Permanent so you can always reference it. The subtasks aren't meant to be 'completed' ‚Äî they're documentation!
